comment._content: Businessman, some background in a New York Times article of 1914.

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: There's a 1914 painting of John Claflin by Eugene Edward Speicher in the New York Chamber of Commerce Portrait Collection at the New York State Museum.

comment.author: 27859140@N08
comment._content: Source: Picture History, John Clafflin Source's link: www.picturehistory.com/product/id/5418 John Claflin was born in 1850 and died in 1938. He was the leading dry goods merchant in the US in the early part of the 20th century. He was the president of the chamber of commerce of the state of New york for 2 years, from 1912 to 1914.
